page.title: 03FORESTRY COMMISSION
page.content: The Forestry Commission, formed in 1919, has looked after the forest since 1924. The compartmented area of forest totals nearly 11000 hectares of which 9500 hectares grow trees. Annual timber production approaches 50000 cubic metres - about one-third hardwood products and the rest conifers. In addition to the growing of timber, its objectives include the provision of facilities for public recreation and the protection/enhancement of the area. All areas of the forest are open to the public on foot and many waymarked footpaths exist. As most visitors to the forest now arrive by car, much of the recreational development in recent years has catered for the motorist. Its headquarters, at Coleford also houses the Deputy Gaveller who looks the area's mines and quarries.
